document.title: Pearson Edexcel Level 1/Level 2 GCSE (9-1) in Computer Science (1CP2)

93E38301E7F545A3BA5C8B4569E17598.description:
understand the difference between and be able to write
programs that make appropriate use of global and local
variables

D4F9E1C19E8A453CBAFE5C840876899F.description:
be able to write functions that may or may not take
parameters but must return values, and procedures that
may or may not take parameters but do not return values

9A4D573FE88740D0B3E5A372643FB16A.description:
be able to write programs that use pre-existing (built-in,
library) and user-devised subprograms (procedures,
functions)

0355E1E1397042158FC61918B7D86103.description:
be able to write programs that use logical operators (AND,
OR, NOT)

BDB9F9F251944513A4DA48F5D5F43CEF.description:
be able to write programs that use relational operators
(equal to, less than, greater than, not equal to, less than
or equal to, greater than or equal to)

012864AFAE8B44FAA3DF3D41DCB6B6D1.description:
be able to write programs that use arithmetic operators
(addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, modulus,
integer division, exponentiation)

0402410FB3B34295B2B9C44BC691D7CE.description:
understand the need for and be able to write programs
that implement authentication (ID and password, lookup)

3D66CCDC35AB490284588A9D023F81B2.description:
understand the need for and be able to write programs
that implement validation (length check, presence check,
range check, pattern check)

EED0E01C742B4A1CA76E7ACC6877F7B7.description:
be able to write programs that read from and write to
comma separated value text files

9F0C3669428D4A59950875C0014081D6.description:
be able to write programs that accept and respond
appropriately to user input

63D8FEF45A7244D7A4CDFCE17D230F3C.description:
be able to write programs that manipulate strings (length,
position, substrings, case conversion)

062104A8BCD242E280DD7E9E319D1E07.description:
be able to write programs that make appropriate use of
variables and constants

55A6C777830E4DB5B14232AB0B82C709.description:
be able to write programs that make appropriate use of
primitive data types (integer, real, Boolean, char) and oneand two-dimensional structured data types (string, array,
record)

88652ECE4BD44F2CB0BB726EDA04F390.description:
be able to write programs that make appropriate use of
sequencing, selection, repetition (count-controlled,
condition-controlled), iteration (over every item in a data
structure) and single entry/exit points from code blocks
and subprograms

1BA7A157A06E4FDB87CB048F2585E3D7.description:
understand the function of and be able to identify the
structural components of programs (constants, variables,
initialisation and assignment statements, command
sequences, selection, repetition, iteration, data structures,
subprograms, parameters, input/output)

74AAB387B9A041C5AC66ADA850708B15.description:
be able to use logical reasoning and test data to evaluate a
program’s fitness for purpose and efficiency (number of
compares, number of passes through a loop, use of
memory)

A68CB6065ED14DA783BAA3244B86AB97.description:
be able to identify, locate and correct program errors
(logic, syntax, runtime)

47E1FF99ACCB4E8E957060ACE782FF23.description:
be able to use techniques (layout, indentation, comments,
meaningful identifiers, white space) to make programs
easier to read, understand and maintain

7D36366D4AB24A84ABECA101D87F90C5.description:
be able to convert algorithms (flowcharts, pseudocode*)
into programs

D7B8D113A6254318B36287D6B9DB5F7F.description:
be able to read, write, analyse and refine programs written
in a high-level programming language

C42711123FEA4F92B0E41EF767F8F565.description:
be able to use decomposition and abstraction to analyse,
understand and solve problems

8D7082E288834EFCADECFC96DA9F8488.description:
understand methods of protecting digital systems and data
(anti-malware, encryption, acceptable use policies, backup
and recovery procedures)

7F63A5D9C99C49B5B2C5DD08FDA30C10.description:
understand the threat to digital systems posed by malware
(viruses, worms, Trojans, ransomware, key loggers) and
how hackers exploit technical vulnerabilities (unpatched
software, out-of-date anti-malware) and use social
engineering to carry out cyberattacks

D6003689BD3E4A23AA3AE632BBBB0403.description:
understand methods of intellectual property protection for
computer systems and software (copyright, patents,
trademarks, licencing)

6F9273AE96DE4FCBA1BEA8858A22545A.description:
understand ethical and legal issues associated with the use
of artificial intelligence, machine learning and robotics
(accountability, safety, algorithmic bias, legal liability)

2186A3FA3E4943FBA20F9DB8D396BC8D.description:
understand ethical and legal issues associated with the
collection and use of personal data (privacy, ownership,
consent, misuse, data protection)

97A3DB01895449A49DEAD15A0A2E0D45.description:
understand environmental issues associated with the use
of digital devices (energy consumption, manufacture,
replacement cycle, disposal)

97D863A4D4AA4A328F4A2CF766A06DDB.description:
understand the importance of network security, ways of
identifying network vulnerabilities (penetration testing,
ethical hacking) and methods of protecting networks
(access control, physical security, firewalls)

A7148FF4FAD84F76BC425835F7A509A3.description:
understand characteristics of network topologies (bus, star,
mesh)

E9562E750F1B46CC96AFF339BBB5E80F.description:
understand how the 4-layer (application, transport,
internet, link) TCP/IP model handles data transmission
over a network

C6CBE64C260043B1850DC0A933BF2A67.description:
understand the role of and need for network protocols
(Ethernet, Wi-Fi, TCP/IP, HTTP, HTTPS, FTP) and email
protocols (POP3, SMTP, IMAP)

19393E416899403590A73EA33D5917DB.description:
understand that network speeds are measured in bits per
second (kilobit, megabit, gigabit) and be able to construct
expressions involving file size, transmission rate and time

01C08CC8BC3D4344A6A663A32CBE7419.description:
understand how the characteristics of wired and wireless
connectivity impact on performance (speed, range, latency,
bandwidth)

F0798F2C10CC4C588F6054A79CB82D42.description:
understand how the internet is structured
(IP addressing, routers)

41E6C197EA7941B3862F7082A2C31C0F.description: understand different types of networks (LAN, WAN)

EEBE07C219D94FFCB11CDF779BC70EE7.description: understand why computers are connected in a network

66F2644D713A420CA65CC43DD3E76596.description:
understand how an interpreter differs from a compiler in
the way it translates high-level code into machine code

F6BFDF93ADBB4568A430934AA40E094A.description:
understand the characteristics and purposes of low-level
and high-level programming languages

BF274A01F0D94905839CCDE46EBCC180.description:
understand the importance of developing robust software
and methods of identifying vulnerabilities (audit trails, code
reviews)

B0385A26FA464650A15EA1C609A08129.description:
understand the purpose and functionality of utility software
(file repair, backup, data compression, disk
defragmentation, anti-malware)

F08762FF01B34F5ABE9B7D2EBCD64082.description:
understand the purpose and functionality of an operating
system (file management, process management,
peripheral management, user management)

7B03958D723643B3BEA89724760E08F3.description:
understand the concept of an embedded system and what
embedded systems are used for

F21A6A237C2F4CE1A6C06A2894689B65.description:
understand the role of secondary storage and the ways in
which data is stored on devices (magnetic, optical, solid
state)

3CB3E77B23174CF499A299B84D830027.description:
understand the von Neumann stored program concept and
the role of main memory (RAM), CPU (control unit,
arithmetic logic unit, registers), clock, address bus, data
bus, control bus in the fetch-decode-execute cycle

CF65DE2C76A945FEBDBD36F9294B4646.description:
understand the need for data compression and methods of
compressing data (lossless, lossy)

0A8F49D9BFCB464687C75760BD0456C2.description:
understand that data storage is measured in binary
multiples (bit, nibble, byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte,
tebibyte) and be able to construct expressions to calculate
file sizes and data capacity requirements

2A978F313434448CAF51E74B5E1FD994.description:
understand the limitations of binary representation of data
when constrained by the number of available bits

6875DA78958B43CC9552B8573F7E654B.description:
understand how analogue sound is represented in binary
(amplitude, sample rate, bit depth, sample interval)

90E11F9AD174492C8C2488692002D5A9.description:
understand how bitmap images are represented in binary
(pixels, resolution, colour depth)

C0FFEE69EE9D471BB4C74F69B5E69C76.description:
understand how computers encode characters using 7-bit
ASCII

DB1F302DFA9D40E2B83EDD17C93EC6EF.description:
understand why hexadecimal notation is used and be able to
convert between hexadecimal and binary

8907DE8838CD49278C9DA7CA78633304.description:
understand the concept of overflow in relation to the
number of bits available to store a value

F0E3B2B7C1DF4F93A1C1F83C5EFF33B7.description:
be able to add together two positive binary patterns and
apply logical and arithmetic binary shifts

4ADDE63801644DC1962324E92619CF4F.description:
be able to convert between denary and 8-bit binary
numbers (0 to 255, -128 to +127)

FDA5B3DA062A4CAAB255CBAE30DF283C.description:
understand how computers represent and manipulate
unsigned integers and two’s complement signed integers

97169E52D74E47E092C4B52016C04937.description:
understand that computers use binary to represent data
(numbers, text, sound, graphics) and program instructions
and be able to determine the maximum number of states
that can be represented by a binary pattern of a given
length

DDB94170D0E049FB9275D1D580E48E03.description:
be able to apply logical operators (AND, OR, NOT) in truth
tables with up to three inputs to solve problems

CD3A35B3F6BF4885A91C81AC52097CCC.description:
be able to use logical reasoning and test data to evaluate
an algorithm’s fitness for purpose and efficiency (number of
compares, number of passes through a loop, use of
memory)

FB2A26D7B34A42FFA4A099E040FA7A9D.description:
understand how standard algorithms (bubble sort, merge
sort, linear search, binary search) work

8A5D10E9BEF94DCE8733FA6A47DA9368.description:
understand types of errors that can occur in programs
(syntax, logic, runtime) and be able to identify and correct
logic errors in algorithms

6BE044AC24F541C39EB24CDE931E1848.description:
be able to determine the correct output of an algorithm for
a given set of data and use a trace table to determine what
value a variable will hold at a given point in an algorithm

22D60F231067414990C684B93013D5D2.description:
understand the need for and be able to follow and write
algorithms that use arithmetic operators (addition, subtraction,
division, multiplication, modulus, integer division,
exponentiation), relational operators (equal to, less than,
greater than, not equal to, less than or equal to, greater than
or equal to) and logical operators (AND, OR, NOT)

072DF48D3CF64EF5BA0684D5A87DB134.description:
understand the need for and be able to follow and write
algorithms that use variables and constants and one- and
two-dimensional data structures (strings, records, arrays)

5629F6F9FAFA456289A2DD2923F1776A.description:
be able to follow and write algorithms (flowcharts,
pseudocode, program code) that use sequence, selection,
repetition (count-controlled, condition-controlled) and
iteration (over every item in a data structure), and input,
processing and output to solve problems

A87EC1B037AD4D54B35A86FA832C321F.description: understand the benefits of using subprograms

1365F7F004EF47619F8B6E0E92952642.description:
understand the benefit of using decomposition and
abstraction to model aspects of the re
